item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 17, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Humans have caused 1.5 °C of long-term global warming according to new estimates (197 points | 164 comments)
2. Everything Is Just Functions: Mind-Blowing Insights from SICP and David Beazley (185 points | 91 comments)
3. AlphaProof's Greatest Hits: the coolest bits from the IMO 2024 solutions (53 points | 11 comments)

5. Voyager 1 Breaks Its Silence with NASA via Radio Transmitter Not Used Since 1981 (73 points | 49 comments)
6. Bpftune uses BPF to auto-tune Linux systems (164 points | 40 comments)
7. The bucket brigade device: An analog shift register (43 points | 17 comments)
8. All-in-one embedding model for interleaved text, images, and screenshots (203 points | 23 comments)

10. ML in Go with a Python Sidecar (38 points | 3 comments)
11. Garak, LLM Vulnerability Scanner (95 points | 25 comments)

13. The World Grid and New Geographies of Cooperation (19 points | 3 comments)

20. Memos – An open source Rewinds / Recall (59 points | 11 comments)

22. How to setup self hosted wiki for your startup (72 points | 26 comments)
23. Two Nobel Prize winners want to cancel their own CRISPR patents in Europe (115 points | 89 comments)
24. Transistor for fuzzy logic hardware: promise for better edge computing (12 points | 3 comments)
25. The myth that you can’t build interactive web apps except as single page app (130 points | 75 comments)
26. Lucid dreaming app triples users' awareness in dreams, study finds (27 points | 12 comments)
27. Claude AI built me a React app to compare maps side by side (138 points | 152 comments)
28. Why did Windows 95 setup use three operating systems? (3 points | discuss)
29. Amazon reportedly working on Echo Frames for delivery drivers (4 points | 1 comment)
30. Unit Testing Numerical Routines (60 points | 30 comments)
